  • Constructor Details

    • SlaveThread

      public SlaveThread(Buffer buffer, AtomicInteger solvedCount, CountDownLatch latch, int id, MasterThread.ThreadStats[] threadStats)
      Constructor for SlaveThread.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer from which the SlaveThread retrieves QuadraticEquation objects and roots get place.
      solvedCount - The AtomicInteger to keep track of the total number of equations solved.
      latch - The CountDownLatch to synchronize the completion of SlaveThreads.
      id - The identifier of the SlaveThread.
      threadStats - The array of ThreadStats objects to track information for each SlaveThread.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      The run method executes the processing logic for the SlaveThread. This method is called when the thread is started. The SlaveThread retrieves quadratic equations from a shared buffer, solves them, and stores the resulting roots back into the buffer. Thread-specific statistics are updated, and the CountDownLatch is used for synchronization to signal the completion of equation processing. This method continues running until the equation buffer is empty. The method handles InterruptedException by interrupting the current thread if an interruption occurs during execution.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
